summary: Completed comprehensive testing of the new Completed Epic Review feature. Backend API tests: 10/10 passed (100%). Frontend UI tests: All core functionality working correctly. The Completed Epic page displays an expandable tree view of Epic → Features → User Stories when all items are locked/approved.
passed_tests: Backend: GET /api/features/epic/{epic_id} - List features for locked epic (200)
Backend: GET /api/features/epic/{epic_id} - Returns 404 for non-existent epic
Backend: GET /api/features/epic/{epic_id} - Returns 401 for unauthenticated requests
Backend: GET /api/stories/feature/{feature_id} - List stories for approved feature (200)
Backend: GET /api/stories/feature/{feature_id} - Returns 404 for non-existent feature
Backend: GET /api/stories/feature/{feature_id} - Returns 401 for unauthenticated requests
Backend: GET /api/epics/{epic_id} - Get epic details with snapshot data
Backend: GET /api/epics/{epic_id} - Returns 404 for non-existent epic
Backend: Full Completed Epic data flow - Load epic, features, and stories
Backend: Stats calculation - Features, stories, story points
Frontend: Test Login button works and redirects to dashboard
Frontend: Dashboard shows locked epic with 'Epic Locked' badge
Frontend: Clicking locked epic navigates to /epic/:epicId/review page
Frontend: Completed Epic page displays 'Epic Locked' badge
Frontend: Completed Epic page displays 'Completed' badge with Trophy icon
Frontend: Stats displayed correctly: 1 Feature, 3 Stories, 9 Story Points
Frontend: Epic Details card shows Problem Statement, Desired Outcome, Acceptance Criteria
Frontend: Features tree is expandable/collapsible
Frontend: User stories nested under each feature with 'Approved' badges
Frontend: Story points displayed on each story card (3 pts)
Frontend: Expand All button works - expands all features
Frontend: Collapse All button works - collapses all features
Frontend: Feature cards can be toggled individually
Frontend: 'Epic Complete!' message displayed at bottom
Frontend: Completion summary shows correct counts and story points
Frontend: Auto-redirect from /epic/:epicId to /epic/:epicId/review when epic is fully complete
Frontend: Back to Dashboard button present and functional
critical_code_review_comments: CompletedEpic.jsx is well-structured with proper component organization
Collapsible components from shadcn/ui work correctly for tree view
Auto-redirect logic in Epic.jsx correctly checks for fully complete status
Dashboard.jsx correctly navigates locked epics to review page
All data-testid attributes are present for UI testing
Stats calculation (features, stories, story points) is accurate
User stories display in standard format with Given/When/Then acceptance criteria
seed_data_creation: Used existing test data: epic_story_test_46de1163 (locked epic), feat_story_test_3817da07 (approved feature), 3 approved user stories with 9 total story points
context_for_next_testing_agent: Completed Epic Review feature is fully functional. The page displays at /epic/:epicId/review when an epic is fully complete (epic locked + all features approved + all stories approved). Test data: epic_story_test_46de1163 with 1 approved feature and 3 approved user stories (9 story points total). Test user: testuser@jarlpm.dev with session_token=test_session_jarlpm_full_access_2025. The Epic page auto-redirects to review page when fully complete. Dashboard also navigates locked epics directly to review page.
